subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you hear is what you get
author: SnowfireL@aol.com
full_text:
-------------------------------1242448643
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

I am new at this, and I am using a RS 20-125, I am not sure how to adjust  
the tape, I bought the Gold Wave, it seems the easiest to use.  It needs to  
be filtered, not sure how much to do, or really what to do, to make them be 
 heard better.  I have only done a few short sessions, this one is the  
longest, and I could hear them talking away, and seems they did answer my  
questions, now I got to figure out a way to make them clearer, and maybe slow em 
 down. sf
 
 
In a message dated 5/16/2009 12:14:01 A.M. Eastern Daylight Time,  
clockdryve@... writes:

 
 


These answers today (strong) are they from recorder or Box? It has been  
raining off and on here in Des Moines, Iowa today. Might slip outside in a few 
 minutes to check em out. -- In _EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ 
(mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com) ,  SnowfireL@..,  Sn
>
> Well, in that last 5.5 minute tape I  made, i asked What's this animal 
> called, they someone answered, then  I asked what color is my shirt, they 
> answered, they are very strong  today
> 
> 
> In a message dated 5/15/2009 5:41:03 P.M.  Eastern Daylight Time, 
> Threadsintyme@ Threadsint
>  
> 
> 
> 
> 
> It might just make a difference  if we knew what shape dem ears of yurns' 
> are! LOL
> Al

> From: _Frank Sumption_ (mailto:purplealien From: _Fr
> To:  _EVP-ITC@yahoogroup To:  _EVP-I_EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ 
(mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com) )  
> Sent: Friday, May 15, 2009 2:14 PM
> Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re:  what you hear is what you get
> 
> 
> 
> I always  listen to EVP wiht my ears!--I know--alien humor.
> 
> On Fri, May  15, 2009 at 1:24 PM, April Abercrombie 
>  <_april@abercrombie_april@abercromb_april@abercrombi_april@ab> wrote:
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I  always listen to EVP's with high quality headphones.
> 
> In the  "tomorrow let you know" EVP, I do hear something... In the  
"tomorr
> sure that it is a voice. I does have a cadence similar to someone  
speaking, 
> but it could just as easily be something present in the  environment- bu
> could just as easily be something present in the  environment-<WBR>a na 
it is 
> just too feint. I can't make  out any clear words. Sure-I could probably 
> matrix some in, but that  is all it would be.
> 
> For an EVP to be considered proof  positive of spirit communication by 
the 
> community at large, it has to  be clear enough that many people hear the 
> same thing, without hints  or coaxing. If you have to have high quality 
devices 
> to make it out,  it just isn't good enough. That does not mean it isn't a 
> true EVP,  just that it isn't good enough to stand as evidence.
> 
> As for  the whistle, it sounded like feedback to me as well, but I will 
> have  to take you word for it that you were no where near any other 
electronics  
> or EMF's that could contribute to feedback. Even so, if I am trying  to 
> remain unbiased and objective, there is no way for me to say this  is a 
spirit, 
> without personally being with you when you caught it.  The only thing I 
can 
> still say about it is could be, but for me it is  non conclusive.
> 
> If someone does not hear what you are  hearing, try to remain objective 
and 
> just understand that it isn't  personal. You have to understand that with 
> just these recordings  alone, there is no way to scientifically prove 
what 
> you have recorded  is spirit communication. If you could get consistent, 
> intelligent  question and answer recordings, then you would be alot 
closer.
>  
> Here again, we are back to the "So what?" thing. You don't HAVE to  prove 
> anything scientifically, unless you want others to completely  believe in 
> your evidence.
> 
> The theory that is being  kicked around is that some EVP's are personal, 
> and only meant for the  person recording them to hear. If this is the 
case, no 
> matter how  clear something is to you, others may not hear it.
> 
>  April
> 
> 
> 
> 
> ----- Original Message -----  
> From: _James W. Hyslope_ (mailto:clockdryve@ From
> To:  _EVP-ITC@yahoogroup To:  _EVP-I_EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_

> Okay, I can respect that. If you can't hear them  then it must be either 
> mechanical (sound card or headphones)or maybe  your hearing has loss in 
those 
> frequencies. frequencies.<WBR>Okay, I can respect  that. If you can't 
hear the
> either mechanical (sound  card or headpho& your headphones. I have let an 
> older man listen  (in his late 60's) and he has heard most all of the 
audio. 
> Same with  a few guys at work. Some hear them right away, and others 
can't 
> until  I loop the actually EVP for a few tries. I personally use a Dell 
>  Latitude D430 to hear these. I can hear some on my cell phone. 
Headphones are  a 
> must....or you won't hear anything either way. *But some can be  heard on 
> cell phone without headphones. The conversion to MP3 has  also caused 
some 
> loss, but I am still able to hear them when I review  from this site (but 
I 
> have the repetive hearing syndrome in this area  no doubt). Although I do 
have 
> some disbelief (shock) that a few of  these are not discernable. Go back 
> and listen to "tomorrow let you  know" is in a gruffy-robotic melodic 
tone at 
> the very end but with  higher natural volume. And if you couldn't hear 
the 
> whistle...I would  suggest the need to remove the cotton from the ear :) 
As 
> for  feedback.... repetive hearing syndrome in this area no doubt). 
>  Although I do have some disbelief (shock) that a few of these are not 
>  discernable. Go back and listen to "tomorrow let you know" is in a  
gruffy-robotic 
> melodic tone at the very end but with higher natural  volume. And if you 
> couldn't hear the whistle...I would suggest the  need to remove the 
cotton from 
> the ear :) As for  feedback....<WBR>.feedb_.feedb_<WBR>EVP-.feedb_<W
>  (mailto:_EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com) ) ,  
"April Abercrombie" <april@> wrote:
> >
> > Here's the  thing though - if you put something out there, and ask 
people 
> to  listen to it, your inviting opinions. Some will be in agreement, and 
>  some won't, no matter what.
> > 
> > If EVP messages are for  the one that recorded them, then it shouldn't 
> surprise you , or  offend you, if someone doesn't hear the same thing you 
do. 
> If you  don't want contrary opinions on something, then you should not 
give 
>  people the chance to critique.
> > 
> > Now I could see if  someone flat out said your recordings were all 
trash, 
> period. You  would have every right to be angry, but no one is saying 
that, 
> at  least I am not saying that.
> > 
> > I just stated that I  did not hear what James heard, and though I 
wasn't 
> going to say he  doesn't have anything, I can't say that he does either.

really

everyone

>  > I get really tired of these self proclaimed experts trying to dicate

> > Here are my opinions (I have truncated the file names due  to laziness):
> > 
> > ahh_mmm noises, no speech
>  > call_us noises, no speech
> > cal_us (enhanced) several  listenings: pixelated, no speech
> > compare_panasonic noises, no  speech
> > compare_sony noises, no speech
> > first_epv  noises, no speech
> > good_whistle noises, no speech (maybe  feedback)
> > hey_can noises, no speech
> > hey_whats  noises, no speech
> > I_hit noises, no speech
> >  important_date noises, no speech
> > keep_moving several listenings:  Hellalal see woobeh

> >  lets_wait several listenings: noises, no speech

> > miss_you noises, no speech
> > my_question  several listenings: no da lee
> > oh_ noises, no speech
> >  something several listenings: noises, no speech

> > that's_jim noises, no speech
> > this_one  several listenings: noises, no speech

> > The ones that took several listenings I  thought I might hear words in, 
> so I examined those several times.  Sometimes I could sort of hear 
something 
> that sort of sounded like  what you suggested, but I could also hear it 
in 
> other ways, or not at  all.
> > 
> > So my suggestion to you, if you want to get  less subjective 
conjuctures 
> or simply less affirmations of your own  interpretations, is to post the 
> future ones without labels. The  labels you give can influence the 
listeners: 
> when you have a sound  that could be several things, and you note that it 
> sounded like "keep  it moving", the listener can find it nearly 
impossible to 
> try NOT to  hear what you heard, and so not be able to give a fresh 
> perspecive to  help your research methods. 
> > 
> > 
> > 
>  > --- In _EVP-ITC@yahoogroup --- In _EVP-IT_EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_
